title: Install OO Containerized on AWS (EKS)
content:
This section contains high-level installation instructions for OO Containerized on AWS EKS alongside Service Management. To enable Service Management to work with OO Containerized, you must configure a load balancer between Service Management and OO.

Perform the following steps to install OO Containerized:

Topic Description
Plan Review the required resources and create a deployment plan for the installation of OO with EKS:
  • Review support matrix
  • Plan the deployment
Prepare Prepare the required resources for the installation of OO with EKS:
  1. Download OO charts package
  2. Download and upload container images for OO
  3. Configure EFS for OO
  4. Create a new deployment for OO
  5. Prepare persistent volumes and claims for OO
  6. Launch Amazon RDS for OO
  7. Get connection details for connecting to the Service Management IdM
  8. Create OO integration admin user in the Service Management IdM
  9. Generate sensitive data for OO
  10. Create values.yaml for OO
  11. Configure load balancers for OO
Post-install task
  1. Install OO on AWS
  2. Verify the OO installation in EKS
Deploy
  1. Install OO on AWS
  2. Verify the OO installation in EKS
Install external OO components

Install external OO components
Uninstall

Uninstall OO on AWS

You must install OO on the same OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT) on which Service Management is also installed.

You must use separate RDS instances for Service Management and containerized OO.
